children.subject: true, i already emailed professors a while ago but wasn't able to hear back from them! I'm an international student who's trying to decide whether if i should go back to U.S. or not (if I'll be taking all online/remote classes, i'd rather not go back) so i hope they'll get back to me soon :(

From what I know, lecture will be remote, all labs remote, and some discussions remote. Please sign up for a remote discussion. From the instruction FAQ, remote classes should plan on giving remote exams.

I don't think anyone can answer this except the professor, who probably hasn't decided on the course logistics yet. You should try emailing the professor, but I wouldn't expect an answer until closer to the start of the semester.

history.content: 16A will offer remote lecture, remote labs, and remote discussions. However, I am unsure if the professors will provide remote exams yet. The professors will be the ones to have the answer to this question. If you do not hear back from them you may have to wait until the first day of class to ask them if they will offer remote midterms and final.

16A will offer remote lecture, remote labs, and remote discussions. However, I am unsure if the professors will provide remote exams yet. The professors will be the ones to have the answer to this question. If you do not hear back from them you may have to wait until the first day of class to ask them about this.

Hi! I'm an incoming international transfer student who's planning to take EECS 16A this upcoming fall semester. However, due to several concerns/issues regarding covid-19, I won't be able to get back to the campus this fall, which makes me unable to take classes that are not entirely remote, including exams. Therefore, I'm wondering if I'll be able to take this class remotely back in my home country!

Thank you!
history.subject: EECS 16A online/remote for fall 2021?
